description: Gets information about an Amazon Kendra data source connector.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The identifier of the data source connector.

parameters.name: IndexId
parameters.description: The identifier of the index used with the data source connector.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the data source connector.

nested_items.name: IndexId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the index used with the data source connector.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name for the data source connector.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of the data source. For example, SHAREPOINT.

nested_items.name: Configuration
nested_items.description: Configuration details for the data source connector. This shows how the data source is configured. The configuration options for a data source depend on the data source provider.

nested_items.name: S3Configuration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to an Amazon S3 bucket as your data source.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the bucket that contains the documents.

nested_items.name: InclusionPrefixes
nested_items.description: A list of S3 prefixes for the documents that should be included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of glob patterns (patterns that can expand a wildcard pattern into a list of path names that match the given pattern) for certain file names and file types to include in your index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion prefix or pattern, the exclusion prefix takes precendence and the document is not indexed. Examples of glob patterns include:
/myapp/config/*--All files inside config directory.
**/.png*--All .png files in all directories.
**/.{png, ico, md}*--All .png, .ico or .md files in all directories.
/myapp/src/*/.ts--All .ts files inside src directory (and all its subdirectories).
**/!(.module).ts*--All .ts files but not .module.ts.
**.png , .jpg--All PNG and JPEG image files in a directory (files with the extensions .png and .jpg).

nested_items.name: ExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of glob patterns (patterns that can expand a wildcard pattern into a list of path names that match the given pattern) for certain file names and file types to exclude from your index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion prefix or pattern, the exclusion prefix takes precendence and the document is not indexed. Examples of glob patterns include:
/myapp/config/*--All files inside config directory.
**/.png*--All .png files in all directories.
**/.{png, ico, md}*--All .png, .ico or .md files in all directories.
/myapp/src/*/.ts--All .ts files inside src directory (and all its subdirectories).
**/!(.module).ts*--All .ts files but not .module.ts.
**.png , .jpg--All PNG and JPEG image files in a directory (files with the extensions .png and .jpg).

nested_items.name: DocumentsMetadataConfiguration
nested_items.description: Document metadata files that contain information such as the document access control information, source URI, document author, and custom attributes. Each metadata file contains metadata about a single document.

nested_items.name: S3Prefix
nested_items.description: A prefix used to filter metadata configuration files in the Amazon Web Services S3 bucket. The S3 bucket might contain multiple metadata files. Use S3Prefix to include only the desired metadata files.

nested_items.name: AccessControlListConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the path to the S3 bucket that contains the user context filtering files for the data source. For the format of the file, see Access control for S3 data sources.

nested_items.name: KeyPath
nested_items.description: Path to the Amazon S3 bucket that contains the ACL files.

nested_items.name: SharePointConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to Microsoft SharePoint as your data source.

nested_items.name: SharePointVersion
nested_items.description: The version of Microsoft SharePoint that you use.

nested_items.name: Urls
nested_items.description: The Microsoft SharePoint site URLs for the documents you want to index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret that contains the user name and password required to connect to the SharePoint instance. For more information, see Microsoft SharePoint.

nested_items.name: CrawlAttachments
nested_items.description: TRUE to index document attachments.

nested_items.name: UseChangeLog
nested_items.description: TRUE to use the SharePoint change log to determine which documents require updating in the index. Depending on the change log's size, it may take longer for Amazon Kendra to use the change log than to scan all of your documents in SharePoint.

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain documents in your SharePoint. Documents that match the patterns are included in the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain documents in your SharePoint. Documents that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your Microsoft SharePoint. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers for subnets within your Amazon VPC. The subnets should be able to connect to each other in the VPC, and they should have outgoing access to the Internet through a NAT device.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers of security groups within your Amazon VPC. The security groups should enable Amazon Kendra to connect to the data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map SharePoint data source attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to SharePoint fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The SharePoint data source field names must exist in your SharePoint custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The Microsoft SharePoint attribute field that contains the title of the document.

nested_items.name: DisableLocalGroups
nested_items.description: TRUE to disable local groups information.

nested_items.name: SslCertificateS3Path
nested_items.description: The path to the SSL certificate stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. You use this to connect to SharePoint Server if you require a secure SSL connection.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket that contains the file.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The name of the file.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationType
nested_items.description: Whether you want to connect to SharePoint Online using basic authentication of user name and password, or OAuth authentication of user name, password, client ID, and client secret, or AD App-only authentication of client secret.

nested_items.name: ProxyConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information to connect to your Microsoft SharePoint site URLs via instance via a web proxy. You can use this option for SharePoint Server.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The name of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.

nested_items.name: Credentials
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret. You create a secret to store your credentials in Secrets Manager.

nested_items.name: DatabaseConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to a database as your data source.

nested_items.name: DatabaseEngineType
nested_items.description: The type of database engine that runs the database.

nested_items.name: ConnectionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information that's required to connect to a database.

nested_items.name: DatabaseHost
nested_items.description: The name of the host for the database. Can be either a string (host.subdomain.domain.tld) or an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

nested_items.name: DatabasePort
nested_items.description: The port that the database uses for connections.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the database containing the document data.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table that contains the document data.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret that stores the credentials. The credentials should be a user-password pair. For more information, see Using a Database Data Source. For more information about Secrets Manager, see What Is Secrets Manager in the Secrets Manager user guide.

nested_items.name: VpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to an Amazon VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers for subnets within your Amazon VPC. The subnets should be able to connect to each other in the VPC, and they should have outgoing access to the Internet through a NAT device.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers of security groups within your Amazon VPC. The security groups should enable Amazon Kendra to connect to the data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ColumnConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about where the index should get the document information from the database.

nested_items.name: DocumentIdColumnName
nested_items.description: The column that provides the document's identifier.

nested_items.name: DocumentDataColumnName
nested_items.description: The column that contains the contents of the document.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleColumnName
nested_items.description: The column that contains the title of the document.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: An array of objects that map database column names to the corresponding fields in an index. You must first create the fields in the index using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: ChangeDetectingColumns
nested_items.description: One to five columns that indicate when a document in the database has changed.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AclConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the database column that provides information for user context filtering.

nested_items.name: AllowedGroupsColumnName
nested_items.description: A list of groups, separated by semi-colons, that filters a query response based on user context. The document is only returned to users that are in one of the groups specified in the UserContext field of the Query API.

nested_items.name: SqlConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information about how Amazon Kendra uses quote marks around SQL identifiers when querying a database data source.

nested_items.name: QueryIdentifiersEnclosingOption
nested_items.description: Determines whether Amazon Kendra encloses SQL identifiers for tables and column names in double quotes (') when making a database query.

nested_items.name: SalesforceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to Salesforce as your data source.

nested_items.name: ServerUrl
nested_items.description: The instance URL for the Salesforce site that you want to index.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Managersecret that contains the key/value pairs required to connect to your Salesforce instance. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:
authenticationUrl - The OAUTH endpoint that Amazon Kendra connects to get an OAUTH token.
consumerKey - The application public key generated when you created your Salesforce application.
consumerSecret - The application private key generated when you created your Salesforce application.
password - The password associated with the user logging in to the Salesforce instance.
securityToken - The token associated with the user logging in to the Salesforce instance.
username - The user name of the user logging in to the Salesforce instance.

nested_items.name: StandardObjectConfigurations
nested_items.description: Configuration of the Salesforce standard objects that Amazon Kendra indexes.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the standard object.

nested_items.name: DocumentDataFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the standard object table that contains the document contents.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the standard object table that contains the document title.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of the standard object to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Salesforce fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Salesforce data source field names must exist in your Salesforce custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: KnowledgeArticleConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for the knowledge article types that Amazon Kendra indexes. Amazon Kendra indexes standard knowledge articles and the standard fields of knowledge articles, or the custom fields of custom knowledge articles, but not both.

nested_items.name: IncludedStates
nested_items.description: Specifies the document states that should be included when Amazon Kendra indexes knowledge articles. You must specify at least one state.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StandardKnowledgeArticleTypeConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for standard Salesforce knowledge articles.

nested_items.name: DocumentDataFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field that contains the document data to index.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field that contains the document title.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of the knowledge article to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Salesforce fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Salesforce data source field names must exist in your Salesforce custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: CustomKnowledgeArticleTypeConfigurations
nested_items.description: Configuration information for custom Salesforce knowledge articles.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the configuration.

nested_items.name: DocumentDataFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the custom knowledge article that contains the document data to index.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the custom knowledge article that contains the document title.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of the custom knowledge article to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Salesforce fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Salesforce data source field names must exist in your Salesforce custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: ChatterFeedConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for Salesforce chatter feeds.

nested_items.name: DocumentDataFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the column in the Salesforce FeedItem table that contains the content to index. Typically this is the Body column.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the column in the Salesforce FeedItem table that contains the title of the document. This is typically the Title column.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps fields from a Salesforce chatter feed into Amazon Kendra index fields.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: IncludeFilterTypes
nested_items.description: Filters the documents in the feed based on status of the user. When you specify ACTIVE_USERS only documents from users who have an active account are indexed. When you specify STANDARD_USER only documents for Salesforce standard users are documented. You can specify both.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CrawlAttachments
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon Kendra should index attachments to Salesforce objects.

nested_items.name: StandardObjectAttachmentConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for processing attachments to Salesforce standard objects.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field used for the document title.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: One or more objects that map fields in attachments to Amazon Kendra index fields.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain documents in your Salesforce. Documents that match the patterns are included in the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain documents in your Salesforce. Documents that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OneDriveConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to Microsoft OneDrive as your data source.

nested_items.name: TenantDomain
nested_items.description: The Azure Active Directory domain of the organization.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Managersecret that contains the user name and password to connect to OneDrive. The user name should be the application ID for the OneDrive application, and the password is the application key for the OneDrive application.

nested_items.name: OneDriveUsers
nested_items.description: A list of user accounts whose documents should be indexed.

nested_items.name: OneDriveUserList
nested_items.description: A list of users whose documents should be indexed. Specify the user names in email format, for example, username@tenantdomain. If you need to index the documents of more than 10 users, use the OneDriveUserS3Path field to specify the location of a file containing a list of users.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OneDriveUserS3Path
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket location of a file containing a list of users whose documents should be indexed.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket that contains the file.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The name of the file.

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain documents in your OneDrive. Documents that match the patterns are included in the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain documents in your OneDrive. Documents that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map OneDrive data source attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to OneDrive fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The OneDrive data source field names must exist in your OneDrive custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: DisableLocalGroups
nested_items.description: TRUE to disable local groups information.

nested_items.name: ServiceNowConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to ServiceNow as your data source.

nested_items.name: HostUrl
nested_items.description: The ServiceNow instance that the data source connects to. The host endpoint should look like the following: {instance}.service-now.com.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Secrets Manager secret that contains the user name and password required to connect to the ServiceNow instance. You can also provide OAuth authentication credentials of user name, password, client ID, and client secret. For more information, see Using a ServiceNow data source.

nested_items.name: ServiceNowBuildVersion
nested_items.description: The identifier of the release that the ServiceNow host is running. If the host is not running the LONDON release, use OTHERS.

nested_items.name: KnowledgeArticleConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for crawling knowledge articles in the ServiceNow site.

nested_items.name: CrawlAttachments
nested_items.description: TRUE to index attachments to knowledge articles.

nested_items.name: IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns applied to include knowledge article attachments. Attachments that match the patterns are included in the index. Items that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns applied to exclude certain knowledge article attachments. Attachments that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Items that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DocumentDataFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document contents field in the Amazon Kendra index.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document title field.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of knoweldge articles to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to ServiceNow fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The ServiceNow data source field names must exist in your ServiceNow custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: FilterQuery
nested_items.description: A query that selects the knowledge articles to index. The query can return articles from multiple knowledge bases, and the knowledge bases can be public or private.

nested_items.name: ServiceCatalogConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for crawling service catalogs in the ServiceNow site.

nested_items.name: CrawlAttachments
nested_items.description: TRUE to index attachments to service catalog items.

nested_items.name: IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain attachments of catalogs in your ServiceNow. Item that match the patterns are included in the index. Items that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain attachments of catalogs in your ServiceNow. Item that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Items that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DocumentDataFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document contents field in the Amazon Kendra index.

nested_items.name: DocumentTitleFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document title field.

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of catalogs to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to ServiceNow fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The ServiceNow data source field names must exist in your ServiceNow custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationType
nested_items.description: The type of authentication used to connect to the ServiceNow instance. If you choose HTTP_BASIC, Amazon Kendra is authenticated using the user name and password provided in the Secrets Manager secret in the SecretArn field. If you choose OAUTH2, Amazon Kendra is authenticated using the credentials of client ID, client secret, user name and password.

nested_items.name: ConfluenceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to Confluence as your data source.

nested_items.name: ServerUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of your Confluence instance. Use the full URL of the server. For example, https://server.example.com:port/. You can also use an IP address, for example, https://192.168.1.113/.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret that contains the user name and password required to connect to the Confluence instance. If you use Confluence Cloud, you use a generated API token as the password.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version or the type of Confluence installation to connect to.

nested_items.name: SpaceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for indexing Confluence spaces.

nested_items.name: CrawlPersonalSpaces
nested_items.description: TRUE to index personal spaces. You can add restrictions to items in personal spaces. If personal spaces are indexed, queries without user context information may return restricted items from a personal space in their results. For more information, see Filtering on user context.

nested_items.name: CrawlArchivedSpaces
nested_items.description: TRUE to index archived spaces.

nested_items.name: IncludeSpaces
nested_items.description: A list of space keys for Confluence spaces. If you include a key, the blogs, documents, and attachments in the space are indexed. Spaces that aren't in the list aren't indexed. A space in the list must exist. Otherwise, Amazon Kendra logs an error when the data source is synchronized. If a space is in both the IncludeSpaces and the ExcludeSpaces list, the space is excluded.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExcludeSpaces
nested_items.description: A list of space keys of Confluence spaces. If you include a key, the blogs, documents, and attachments in the space are not indexed. If a space is in both the ExcludeSpaces and the IncludeSpaces list, the space is excluded.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SpaceFieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of Confluence spaces to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Confluence fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Confluence data source field names must exist in your Confluence custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

nested_items.name: PageConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for indexing Confluence pages.

nested_items.name: PageFieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of Confluence pages to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Confluence fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Confluence data source field names must exist in your Confluence custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

nested_items.name: BlogConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for indexing Confluence blogs.

nested_items.name: BlogFieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of Confluence blogs to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Confluence fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Confluence data source field names must exist in your Confluence custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

nested_items.name: AttachmentConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for indexing attachments to Confluence blogs and pages.

nested_items.name: CrawlAttachments
nested_items.description: TRUE to index attachments of pages and blogs in Confluence.

nested_items.name: AttachmentFieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps attributes or field names of Confluence attachments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Confluence fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Confluence data source field names must exist in your Confluence custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

nested_items.name: VpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your Confluence. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers for subnets within your Amazon VPC. The subnets should be able to connect to each other in the VPC, and they should have outgoing access to the Internet through a NAT device.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers of security groups within your Amazon VPC. The security groups should enable Amazon Kendra to connect to the data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain blog posts, pages, spaces, or attachments in your Confluence. Content that matches the patterns are included in the index. Content that doesn't match the patterns is excluded from the index. If content matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the content isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain blog posts, pages, spaces, or attachments in your Confluence. Content that matches the patterns are excluded from the index. Content that doesn't match the patterns is included in the index. If content matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the content isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProxyConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information to connect to your Confluence URL instance via a web proxy. You can use this option for Confluence Server.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The name of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.

nested_items.name: Credentials
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret. You create a secret to store your credentials in Secrets Manager.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationType
nested_items.description: Whether you want to connect to Confluence using basic authentication of user name and password, or a personal access token. You can use a personal access token for Confluence Server.

nested_items.name: GoogleDriveConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to Google Drive as your data source.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Secrets Managersecret that contains the credentials required to connect to Google Drive. For more information, see Using a Google Workspace Drive data source.

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain items in your Google Drive, including shared drives and users' My Drives. Items that match the patterns are included in the index. Items that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain items in your Google Drive, including shared drives and users' My Drives. Items that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Items that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FieldMappings
nested_items.description: Maps Google Drive data source attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Google Drive fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Google Drive data source field names must exist in your Google Drive custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: ExcludeMimeTypes
nested_items.description: A list of MIME types to exclude from the index. All documents matching the specified MIME type are excluded.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExcludeUserAccounts
nested_items.description: A list of email addresses of the users. Documents owned by these users are excluded from the index. Documents shared with excluded users are indexed unless they are excluded in another way.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExcludeSharedDrives
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers or shared drives to exclude from the index. All files and folders stored on the shared drive are excluded.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: WebCrawlerConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information required for Amazon Kendra Web Crawler.

nested_items.name: SeedUrlConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration of the seed or starting point URLs of the websites you want to crawl.

nested_items.name: SeedUrls
nested_items.description: The list of seed or starting point URLs of the websites you want to crawl.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: WebCrawlerMode
nested_items.description: You can choose one of the following modes:
HOST_ONLY--crawl only the website host names. For example, if the seed URL is 'abc.example.com', then only URLs with host name 'abc.example.com' are crawled.
SUBDOMAINS--crawl the website host names with subdomains. For example, if the seed URL is 'abc.example.com', then 'a.abc.example.com' and 'b.abc.example.com' are also crawled.
EVERYTHING--crawl the website host names with subdomains and other domains that the web pages link to.

nested_items.name: SiteMapsConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration of the sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl.

nested_items.name: SiteMaps
nested_items.description: The list of sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CrawlDepth
nested_items.description: The --depth' or number of levels from the seed level to crawl. For example, the seed URL page is depth 1 and any hyperlinks on this page that are also crawled are depth 2.

nested_items.name: MaxLinksPerPage
nested_items.description: The maximum number of URLs on a web page to include when crawling a website. This number is per web page.

nested_items.name: MaxContentSizePerPageInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The maximum size (in MB) of a web page or attachment to crawl.

nested_items.name: MaxUrlsPerMinuteCrawlRate
nested_items.description: The maximum number of URLs crawled per website host per minute.

nested_items.name: UrlInclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain URLs to crawl. URLs that match the patterns are included in the index. URLs that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a URL matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the URL file isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: UrlExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain URLs to crawl. URLs that match the patterns are excluded from the index. URLs that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a URL matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the URL file isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProxyConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information required to connect to your internal websites via a web proxy.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The name of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.

nested_items.name: Credentials
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret. You create a secret to store your credentials in Secrets Manager.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information required to connect to websites using authentication.

nested_items.name: BasicAuthentication
nested_items.description: The list of configuration information that's required to connect to and crawl a website host using basic authentication credentials.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The name of the website host you want to connect to using authentication credentials.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number of the website host you want to connect to using authentication credentials.

nested_items.name: Credentials
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret. You create a secret to store your credentials in Secrets Manager.

nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to Amazon WorkDocs as your data source.

nested_items.description: The identifier of the directory corresponding to your Amazon WorkDocs site repository.

nested_items.name: CrawlComments
nested_items.description: TRUE to include comments on documents in your index. Including comments in your index means each comment is a document that can be searched on.

nested_items.name: UseChangeLog
nested_items.description: TRUE to use the Amazon WorkDocs change log to determine which documents require updating in the index. Depending on the change log's size, it may take longer for Amazon Kendra to use the change log than to scan all of your documents in Amazon WorkDocs.

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain files in your Amazon WorkDocs site repository. Files that match the patterns are included in the index. Files that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

nested_items.name: ExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain files in your Amazon WorkDocs site repository. Files that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Files that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map Amazon WorkDocs data source attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Amazon WorkDocs fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Amazon WorkDocs data source field names must exist in your Amazon WorkDocs custom metadata.

nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: FsxConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the configuration information to connect to Amazon FSx as your data source.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon FSx file system.

nested_items.name: FileSystemType
nested_items.description: The Amazon FSx file system type. Windows is currently the only supported type.

nested_items.name: VpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your Amazon FSx. Your Amazon FSx instance must reside inside your VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers for subnets within your Amazon VPC. The subnets should be able to connect to each other in the VPC, and they should have outgoing access to the Internet through a NAT device.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers of security groups within your Amazon VPC. The security groups should enable Amazon Kendra to connect to the data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret that contains the key-value pairs required to connect to your Amazon FSx file system. Windows is currently the only supported type. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:

username--The Active Directory user name, along with the Domain Name System (DNS) domain name. For example, user@corp.example.com. The Active Directory user account must have read and mounting access to the Amazon FSx file system for Windows.
password--The password of the Active Directory user account with read and mounting access to the Amazon FSx Windows file system.

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain files in your Amazon FSx file system. Files that match the patterns are included in the index. Files that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain files in your Amazon FSx file system. Files that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Files that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

slackToken--The user or bot token created in Slack. For more information on creating a token in Slack, see Authentication for a Slack data source.

nested_items.description: Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your Slack. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

nested_items.description: TRUE to use the Slack change log to determine which documents require updating in the index. Depending on the Slack change log's size, it may take longer for Amazon Kendra to use the change log than to scan all of your documents in Slack.

nested_items.name: CrawlBotMessage
nested_items.description: TRUE to index bot messages from your Slack workspace team.

nested_items.name: ExcludeArchived

nested_items.name: SinceCrawlDate
nested_items.description: The date to start crawling your data from your Slack workspace team. The date must follow this format: yyyy-mm-dd.

nested_items.name: LookBackPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of hours for change log to look back from when you last synchronized your data. You can look back up to 7 days or 168 hours.

nested_items.name: PrivateChannelFilter
nested_items.description: The list of private channel names from your Slack workspace team. You use this if you want to index specific private channels, not all private channels. You can also use regular expression patterns to filter private channels.

nested_items.description: The list of public channel names to index from your Slack workspace team. You use this if you want to index specific public channels, not all public channels. You can also use regular expression patterns to filter public channels.

privateKey--A set of characters that make up an encryption key.
passphrase--A set of characters that act like a password.

nested_items.description: A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Alfresco wikis to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Alfresco fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Alfresco data source field names must exist in your Alfresco custom metadata.

nested_items.name: DataSourceFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

nested_items.name: DateFieldFormat
nested_items.description: The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

nested_items.name: IndexFieldName
nested_items.description: The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

nested_items.name: InclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to include certain files in your Alfresco data source. Files that match the patterns are included in the index. Files that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExclusionPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain files in your Alfresco data source. Files that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Files that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your Alfresco. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers for subnets within your Amazon VPC. The subnets should be able to connect to each other in the VPC, and they should have outgoing access to the Internet through a NAT device.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers of security groups within your Amazon VPC. The security groups should enable Amazon Kendra to connect to the data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TemplateConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides a template for the configuration information to connect to your data source.

nested_items.name: Template
nested_items.description: The template schema used for the data source, where templates schemas are supported.

nested_items.name: VpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your data source. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers for subnets within your Amazon VPC. The subnets should be able to connect to each other in the VPC, and they should have outgoing access to the Internet through a NAT device.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of identifiers of security groups within your Amazon VPC. The security groups should enable Amazon Kendra to connect to the data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when the data source connector was created.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when the data source connector was last updated.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description for the data source connector.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the data source connector. When the status is ACTIVE the data source is ready to use. When the status is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field contains the reason that the data source failed.

nested_items.name: Schedule
nested_items.description: The schedule for Amazon Kendra to update the index.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role with permission to access the data source and required resources.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: When the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field contains a description of the error that caused the data source to fail.

nested_items.name: LanguageCode
nested_items.description: The code for a language. This shows a supported language for all documents in the data source. English is supported by default. For more information on supported languages, including their codes, see Adding documents in languages other than English.

nested_items.name: CustomDocumentEnrichmentConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for altering document metadata and content during the document ingestion process when you describe a data source.

nested_items.name: InlineConfigurations
nested_items.description: Configuration information to alter document attributes or metadata fields and content when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra.

nested_items.name: Condition
nested_items.description: Configuration of the condition used for the target document attribute or metadata field when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra.

nested_items.name: ConditionDocumentAttributeKey
nested_items.description: The identifier of the document attribute used for the condition.

nested_items.name: Operator
nested_items.description: The condition operator.

nested_items.name: ConditionOnValue
nested_items.description: The value used by the operator.

nested_items.name: StringValue
nested_items.description: A string, such as 'department'.

nested_items.name: StringListValue
nested_items.description: A list of strings. The default maximum length or number of strings is 10.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LongValue
nested_items.description: A long integer value.

nested_items.name: DateValue
nested_items.description: A date expressed as an ISO 8601 string.

nested_items.name: TargetDocumentAttributeKey
nested_items.description: The identifier of the target document attribute or metadata field.

nested_items.name: TargetDocumentAttributeValueDeletion
nested_items.description: TRUE to delete the existing target value for your specified target attribute key. You cannot create a target value and set this to TRUE. To create a target value ( TargetDocumentAttributeValue), set this to FALSE.

nested_items.name: TargetDocumentAttributeValue
nested_items.description: The target value you want to create for the target attribute.

nested_items.name: StringValue
nested_items.description: A string, such as 'department'.

nested_items.name: StringListValue
nested_items.description: A list of strings. The default maximum length or number of strings is 10.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LongValue
nested_items.description: A long integer value.

nested_items.name: DateValue
nested_items.description: A date expressed as an ISO 8601 string.

nested_items.name: DocumentContentDeletion
nested_items.description: TRUE to delete content if the condition used for the target attribute is met.

nested_items.name: PreExtractionHookConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information for invoking a Lambda function in Lambda on the original or raw documents before extracting their metadata and text. You can use a Lambda function to apply advanced logic for creating, modifying, or deleting document metadata and content. For more information, see Advanced data manipulation.

nested_items.name: InvocationCondition
nested_items.description: The condition used for when a Lambda function should be invoked.

nested_items.name: ConditionDocumentAttributeKey
nested_items.description: The identifier of the document attribute used for the condition.

nested_items.name: Operator
nested_items.description: The condition operator.

nested_items.name: ConditionOnValue
nested_items.description: The value used by the operator.

nested_items.name: StringValue
nested_items.description: A string, such as 'department'.

nested_items.name: StringListValue
nested_items.description: A list of strings. The default maximum length or number of strings is 10.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LongValue
nested_items.description: A long integer value.

nested_items.name: DateValue
nested_items.description: A date expressed as an ISO 8601 string.

nested_items.name: LambdaArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role with permission to run a Lambda function during ingestion. For more information, see an IAM roles for Amazon Kendra.

nested_items.name: S3Bucket
nested_items.description: Stores the original, raw documents or the structured, parsed documents before and after altering them. For more information, see Data contracts for Lambda functions.

nested_items.name: ConditionDocumentAttributeKey

nested_items.description: The condition operator.

nested_items.name: StringValue

nested_items.name: StringListValue
nested_items.description: A list of strings. The default maximum length or number of strings is 10.

nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role with permission to run a Lambda function during ingestion. For more information, see an IAM roles for Amazon Kendra.
